column4: if i download and install unrar from synaptics, it doesn't add an additional program right? it justs adds to ubuntu's default archive manager, the ability to handle rar files?
it installs unrar
which works with ubuntu's archive manager
then i can simply right click on a rar file and choose open with archive manager and it'll work just like any other archive
yes
thanks
so which is better? the free or non-free of unrar?
i see...
alot of people fight about whats better, rar compression or 7lza or whatever it is
yeah tar.gz is common
tar creates on long file, and gzip or bzip2 are the popular linux compression formats
oh they;'re different format altogether
tar is separate from compressing, don't get them confused
oh tar doesn't compress?
i see...
the .extention  is just an extention... so you will see   filename.tar.gz  and you will see filename.tgz  which are the same
did you try the nonfree version?
not yet. this is not normal?
oh there.... i needed the nonfree... hmmm... i wonder why
try just installing unrar   not unrar-free
I'm not too sure why
oh well... whichever works... :)
